page.title: 15The Railway
page.content: In its heyday Broxton station employed a staff of 17. Before road transport became established all the strawberries from Farndon were delivered to the station by the lorry load. Also milk from the farm was transported by rail to Liverpool. The station premises had a cheese warehouse and a coal yard, which were situated between the station and the A41. There was an up and down line with a platform on both sides. The last station master left when the station closed in 1968. Also employed at the station was a porter, signal man and 4 lengthmen. One of the lengthmen was my grandad. To the Malpas side of the station was a signal box and a goods crane, part of which remains in the recently built picnic site which has replaced the derelict station.
